page.title: 05VILLAGE POSTMASTER, CHESHIRE
page.content: The Postmaster who owns a General Store in Comberbach, Cheshire leads a very interesting life. He struggles out of bed at 6.00 a.m. and opens the shop at 7.30. He always looks forward to meeting new people. A stranger comes in and asks for some information about the area. He gives it smilingly, for the shop is the mini-information centre of village life. He hears a tooting horn: his grocery order has arrived. As he collects it, he thinks how this is his favourite job of the day, but he hates mopping the floor! The only local produce he sells is mainly potatoes and vegetables, but he actually stocks most things you can think of. He closes for lunch between one and two. Being the postmaster, he thinks he provides a vital local service, especially to the old-age pensioners who consider him a friend.
